title: TV Actor Aman Jaiswal, 23, Dies As Truck Rams His Bike In Mumbai - NDTV
summary:
TV Actor Aman Jaiswal, 23, Dies As Truck Rams His Bike In Mumbai

Date: January 25, 2025 Source: NDTV

Actor Aman Jaiswal tragically lost his life in a road accident when a truck hit his motorcycle in Mumbai.

  • Aman Jaiswal was 23 years old and known for his role in the TV serial "Dhartiputra Nandini".
  • The accident occurred on Jogeshwari road on Friday afternoon.
  • He was taken to Cama Hospital but succumbed to his injuries.
  • The truck driver has been charged with rash and negligent driving.
  • Police are currently investigating the incident.
“He was rushed to the hospital where he died of his injuries,” said an official from Amboli police station.

This tragic event highlights the dangers of reckless driving and the significant impact such accidents can have.
newTitle: TV Actor Aman Jaiswal, 23, Dies in Mumbai Accident

title: Supreme Court: Suicide abetment charges must not be invoked ‘mechanically’ to comfort deceased’s family - The Indian Express
summary:
Supreme Court: Suicide abetment charges must not be invoked ‘mechanically’ to comfort deceased’s family

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: The Indian Express

The Supreme Court ruled that invoking abetment of suicide charges must not be done mechanically to comfort the deceased’s family. This judgment emphasizes the necessity of a higher legal threshold before such charges are applied.

  • The court discharged a bank manager accused of abetting a suicide linked to loan repayment issues.
  • It criticized the casual application of Section 306 IPC by police, advocating for stricter adherence to legal standards.
  • Justice Viswanathan emphasized genuine cases must not be overlooked while cautioning against procedural abuses.
  • The court stated that emotional outbursts should not be interpreted as instigation to suicide.
  • The decision sets a precedent for how law enforcement and courts should approach suicides connected to debt disputes.
“To attract the ingredient of Section 306, the accused should have abetted the commission of a suicide.”

This ruling seeks to prevent the misuse of suicide abetment charges and ensure that only those responsible for instigating suicide face legal consequences.
newTitle: Supreme Court Clarifies Criteria for Suicide Abetment Charges

title: Spiked juice to ayurvedic drink: Greeshma, Kerala woman who tried to poison boyfriend multiple times before finally succeeding, found guilty - The Indian Express
Spiked juice to ayurvedic drink: Greeshma, Kerala woman who tried to poison boyfriend multiple times before finally succeeding, found guilty - The Indian Express
US consulate opens in Bengaluru; Minister Jaishankar recalls efforts: ‘You get Bengaluru done, I’ll get Los Angeles’ - The Indian Express
summary:
US consulate opens in Bengaluru; Minister Jaishankar recalls efforts: ‘You get Bengaluru done, I’ll get Los Angeles’

Publication Date: January 17, 2025

Source: The Indian Express

After nearly two decades, the US Consulate in Bengaluru was inaugurated, marking an important development in US-India relations.

  • The consulate will not process visa applications initially, but plans to do so in the future.
  • It will operate from the USCS office until a permanent location is established.
  • Minister Jaishankar emphasized its significance in sectors like technology and space.
  • The establishment of the consulate was prioritized ahead of PM Modi’s state visit.
  • Garcetti highlighted Bengaluru's role as a hub for commerce, diplomacy, and technology.
“If you get Bengaluru done, I’ll get Los Angeles done.” – External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar

This consulate is expected to enhance collaboration between India and the US in various sectors and make it easier for residents to access visa services.
newTitle: US Consulate Opens in Bengaluru, Signifying New Era in US-India Relations

title: ‘Driver, guard were made company directors’: ED attaches Rs 443 Cr properties of ex-promoters of Kwality - The Indian Express
summary:
ED Attaches Rs 443 Cr Properties of Former Kwality Promoters in Fraud Case

Date: January 17, 2025 Source: Indian Express

The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has provisionally attached properties worth Rs 442.85 crore connected to the bank fraud case involving Kwality Ltd under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act.

  • The attached properties include a farmhouse, residential properties in upscale areas, and various residential plots.
  • Investigations revealed that former promoters used dummy companies managed by their driver and security guard.
  • ED's investigation is based on an FIR regarding fraudulent activities worth Rs 1,400.62 crore.
  • Search operations previously conducted resulted in the seizure of cash and evidence relating to the fraud.
  • Luxury vehicles and frozen demat accounts linked to the accused were also discovered.
“The funds diverted through the stated modus was circulated, layered to conceal its origin and routed to different accounts as per the instructions of the promoters for purposes not intended by the banks.”

This extensive fraud investigation is likely to have significant repercussions for the involved parties, with assets being actively seized to recover defrauded funds.
newTitle: ED Attaches Rs 443 Cr Properties of Former Kwality Promoters in Fraud Case

title: No contradiction, says MEA after army chief’s remarks on situation on LAC - Hindustan Times
summary:
No contradiction, says MEA after army chief’s remarks on situation on LAC

Date: Jan 17, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

NEW DELHI: There is no contradiction in the positions taken by the external affairs ministry and the army regarding the situation on the Line of Actual Control (LAC), as stated by ministry spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal.

  • Jaiswal emphasized that the “task of de-escalation remains to be addressed” in Ladakh.
  • He referred to a prior understanding between India and China regarding the withdrawal of frontline forces at key friction points.
  • The minister noted that terms of the disengagement agreement continue to hold in relevant areas of eastern Ladakh.
  • Prime Minister Modi and President Xi held talks to revive dialogue mechanisms and normalize bilateral relations.
“There is absolutely no contradiction between the positions taken.” - Randhir Jaiswal

This statement underscores the consistency in India's approach to managing its border tensions with China while emphasizing ongoing diplomatic engagement.
newTitle: No contradiction, says MEA after army chief’s remarks on situation on LAC

title: Modi govt gives its biggest ally another boost—Rs 11,440 crore revival plan for AP’s Vizag Steel Plant - ThePrint
summary:
Modi Government Announces Rs 11,440 Crore Revival Plan for Vizag Steel Plant

Publication Date: January 17, 2025

Source: ThePrint

The Indian government, led by Prime Minister Modi, has announced a significant financial package of Rs 11,440 crore to revive the Visakhapatnam Steel Plant (VSP) in Andhra Pradesh, amidst ongoing protests from workers and unions.

  • Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw confirmed the financial support.
  • The plan aims for full steel production by August 2025 with three blast furnaces operating.
  • Chief Minister Naidu hailed the announcement as a historic moment for Andhra Pradesh.
  • Significant political backing emerged from union leaders against privatization efforts.
  • VSP has been under strain due to financial issues and protests against privatization, which have lasted over 1,430 days.
“Today marks a historic moment etched in steel. It is an emotional and proud moment for people of Andhra Pradesh...” — N Chandrababu Naidu

With this move, the Modi government aims to stabilize the financial situation of RINL, the plant's operator.
newTitle: Modi Government Announces Rs 11,440 Crore Revival Plan for Vizag Steel Plant

title: ED attaches Rs 300-cr worth assets in MUDA-linked money-laundering case - The Tribune India
Donald Trump swearing-in event to be attended by Quad nations' foreign ministers: MEA - Hindustan Times
summary:
Donald Trump Swearing-In Event to Be Attended by Quad Nations' Foreign Ministers

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will represent India at the swearing-in ceremony of Donald Trump on January 20. The foreign ministers from the Quad bloc nations are expected to attend the event, as stated by the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA).

  • The swearing-in ceremony will take place on January 20, 2025.
  • S Jaishankar will represent India at the ceremony, invited by the Trump-Vance Inaugural Committee.
  • Meetings with representatives of the incoming administration are planned during this visit.
  • Donald Trump won the presidential elections in November with 312 electoral votes.
  • PM Modi previously attended the Quad Leaders' Summit in 2024.
“On the invitation of the Trump-Vance Inaugural Committee, External Affairs Minister (EAM) Dr S Jaishankar will represent the Government of India at the Swearing-In Ceremony of President-Elect Donald J. Trump as the 47th President of the United States of America,”

This event marks a significant diplomatic engagement for India as it continues to strengthen relationships with Quad partners.
newTitle: Donald Trump Swearing-In Event to Be Attended by Quad Nations' Foreign Ministers

title: Centre completes drone survey of 67,000 sq km of rural land - The Hindu
summary:
Centre completes drone survey of 67,000 sq km of rural land

Date: January 17, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The Union government has completed a survey of 67,000 sq km of rural land worth ₹132 lakh crore, just before Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to distribute property cards to 65 lakh land owners across ten States.

  • The drone survey is part of the SVAMITVA programme, with an accuracy of five centimetres.
  • 92% of the drone mapping has been completed, covering around 3.17 lakh villages with a target of 3.44 lakh villages by 2026.
  • 31 States and Union Territories have participated; some have their own versions of the scheme.
  • The scheme aims to resolve land disputes and assist landowners in monetizing their properties.
“The property cards will be admissible in banks if land owners apply for loans.”

The survey and subsequent distribution of property cards aim to provide clarity on land ownership and facilitate infrastructure development by panchayats.
newTitle: Centre completes drone survey of 67,000 sq km of rural land

title: 'Direct CBI To Lodge FIR Against Justice Shekhar Yadav': 13 Senior Advocates Write To CJI Sanjiv Khanna - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Direct CBI To Lodge FIR Against Justice Shekhar Yadav: 13 Senior Advocates Write To CJI Sanjiv Khanna

Date: January 17, 2024 Source: Indian Express

In a significant letter, 13 senior advocates of the Supreme Court have requested Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna to take action against Justice Shekhar Yadav of the Allahabad High Court for remarks made in a speech that they classify as hate speech, demanding a CBI investigation.

  • The letter claims Justice Yadav's speech undermines judicial impartiality and constitutional values.
  • Advocates cite Yadav's inflammatory comments made at a public gathering organized by the VHP.
  • Concerns are raised about Justice Yadav's past, including opposition to his appointment by former Chief Justice D.Y. Chandrachud due to extremist links.
  • Yadav reportedly made divisive statements regarding religious communities, promoting a majoritarian view.
  • Advocates demand that the CBI file an FIR against him following a Supreme Court ruling regarding judicial conduct.
“His use of the derogatory ‘kathmulla’ to refer to a section of Muslims is deeply disturbing,” the advocates stated.

The advocates emphasize the need for judicial independence and integrity, urging that such conduct cannot go unaddressed.
newTitle: Senior Advocates Urge CJI to Act Against Justice Shekhar Yadav for Hate Speech

title: Embarrassment for ED as ASG slams it for half-baked affidavit in SC - The Tribune India
Aman Jaiswal, Dhartiputra Nandini Actor Dies In Road Accident At 23 - Times Now
Orissa High Court Bids 'Teary Farewell' To Its 34th Chief Justice Chakradhari Sharan Singh - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Orissa High Court Bids 'Teary Farewell' To Chief Justice Chakradhari Sharan Singh

Date: January 17, 2024

Source: Live Law

The Orissa High Court held an emotional farewell for Chief Justice Chakradhari Sharan Singh on January 17, 2024, as he prepares to retire on January 19 after eleven months of leadership.

  • Justice Singh served as Chief Justice from February 7, 2024.
  • His leadership included significant contributions to renovating judicial infrastructure and addressing social issues.
  • Judges and Bar members praised his empathetic nature and commitment to justice.
  • He shared anecdotes reflecting his deep connection to Odisha and its culture during his farewell speech.
  • With his retirement, the High Court's strength reduces to 18 out of a sanctioned 33 judges.

“The craftsmanship in silver filigree and stone carvings showcases the artistic skills of the local artisans.” - Chief Justice Chakradhari Sharan Singh

Justice Singh's departure marks a significant transition for the Orissa High Court, leaving behind a legacy of compassion and dedication.
newTitle: Orissa High Court Bids 'Teary Farewell' To Chief Justice Chakradhari Sharan Singh

title: Delhi Assembly Elections 2025| BJP manifesto promises many 'freebies', Kejriwal chides PM Modi for 'copying' AAP's success model - Deccan Herald
summary:
BJP Unveils Promises Ahead of Delhi Assembly Elections 2025

Published on: 17 January 2025, Source: Deccan Herald

The BJP has launched its manifesto for the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections, pledging various social welfare initiatives while facing critiques from AAP's Arvind Kejriwal for 'copying' successful schemes.

  • BJP promises a monthly allowance of Rs 2,500 to women under the 'Mahila Samridhi Yojana'.
  • Plans to provide Rs 5 lakh health insurance through the Ayushman Bharat scheme.
  • 'Atal Canteens' will serve meals for Rs 5 in slum areas.
  • Commitment to LPG cylinders at Rs 500 and pension increases for senior citizens.
  • Kejriwal criticizes BJP for adopting AAP's successful welfare policies.
“Modi-ji should come forward and assure he consents to these (BJP) promises. He should tell I was right in providing free handouts.” - Arvind Kejriwal

This election season sees both parties engaging in a battle of welfare promises, with Kejriwal positioning AAP's initiatives as original, while BJP attempts to present its offerings as enhancements.
newTitle: BJP Unveils Promises Ahead of Delhi Assembly Elections 2025

title: Senior lawyers urge CJI to direct CBI to lodge FIR against Allahabad High Court judge Shekhar Kumar Yadav - The Hindu
summary:
Senior Lawyers Urge CJI to Direct CBI to File FIR Against Allahabad High Court Judge

Date: January 17, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Senior advocates have called on the Chief Justice of India to push the CBI to lodge an FIR against judge Shekhar Kumar Yadav for alleged communal comments made during a recent event.

  • The advocates wrote a letter to CJI Sanjiv Khanna concerning comments made by Justice Yadav during a VHP event.
  • They argue that his remarks have created a divisive rhetoric that undermines judicial impartiality.
  • Justice Yadav has denied the allegations, claiming his comments were taken out of context.
  • The letter references a Supreme Court principle for initiating criminal proceedings against judges.
“Justice Yadav’s speech has imprints of multiple offences described under Sections 196 and 302 of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita.”

The legal community urges careful consideration of judicial conduct following these allegations to uphold the integrity of the judiciary.
newTitle: Senior Lawyers Urge CJI to Direct CBI to File FIR Against Allahabad High Court Judge

Centre revokes GRAP 3 curbs in Delhi-NCR amid dip in pollution levels - Hindustan Times
summary:
Centre revokes GRAP 3 restrictions in Delhi-NCR amid dip in pollution levels, says order

Date: Jan 17, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The Centre's air quality panel has revoked the GRAP 3 restrictions in the Delhi-NCR due to improved air quality. This decision follows the earlier revocation of GRAP 4 restrictions.

  • GRAP 3 restrictions were revoked as pollution levels dipped.
  • Classes up to grade 5 will transition to hybrid mode.
  • Restrictions on BS-III petrol and BS-IV diesel vehicles remain in place.
  • Pollution traditionally peaks during winters due to various local sources.
“As per the air quality and weather forecast provided by IMD/IITM, there is a likelihood of AQI to remain in lower end of the Very Poor category in the coming days owing to the favourable meteorological conditions and strong wind speeds,” said CAQM.

This change in restrictions is hoped to improve daily life while maintaining surveillance on air quality management as necessary.
newTitle: Centre Revokes GRAP 3 Restrictions in Delhi-NCR Amid Pollution Drop

title: 'Kitna time lagega': Auto driver recounts rushing Saif Ali Khan to hospital after brutal attack - The Times of India
summary:
Auto Driver Rushes Saif Ali Khan to Hospital After Brutal Attack

Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

In a harrowing incident, an auto driver rushed Bollywood actor Saif Ali Khan to the hospital after he was brutally attacked. The driver’s quick thinking and decisive actions potentially saved Khan's life.

  • Saif Ali Khan was attacked in a public area.
  • The auto driver witnessed the incident and immediately offered aid.
  • Emergency services were contacted while they rushed to the hospital.
  • The incident has raised concerns about safety in public spaces.
"I just thought of his safety and acted as quickly as possible." - Auto driver

This incident not only highlights the bravery of ordinary citizens but also calls attention to the need for improved security measures to ensure the safety of public figures and the general population alike.
newTitle: Auto Driver Rushes Saif Ali Khan to Hospital After Brutal Attack

title: Madras High Court grants bail to Savukku Shankar booked for spreading misinformation - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Madras High Court Grants Bail to Savukku Shankar for Spreading Misinformation

Published on: 17 Jan 2025, 12:53 pm

The Madras High Court granted bail to YouTuber Savukku Shankar, who was arrested for spreading misinformation. The judge noted that the charges did not warrant an arrest.

  • Bail granted by Justice GR Swaminathan.
  • Shankar was charged under various sections for obstructing a public servant and making false statements.
  • The court criticized the basis of the arrest, suggesting viewers should choose whether or not to watch his content.
“How could you arrest somebody for this? You just don't listen to the interview. Those who are interested will listen. That is all.”

The decision highlights the balance between freedom of speech and the actions taken against individuals for their public statements.
newTitle: Madras High Court Grants Bail to Savukku Shankar for Spreading Misinformation

title: Why Govt refused to hold NEET-UG 2025 online despite paper leak controversy - The Indian Express
summary:
Why Govt refused to hold NEET-UG 2025 online despite paper leak controversy

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: The Indian Express

The Union government has decided to conduct the NEET-UG 2025 examination in a pen-and-paper format, despite previous controversies including a paper leak. This decision is rooted in logistical challenges and the significant proportion of rural candidates, who may not be familiar with online testing formats.

  • Despite recommendations to move to computer-based testing, the government reaffirmed the traditional format for NEET-UG.
  • This year, about 28 to 30 lakh candidates are expected to take the exam.
  • Logistical issues, such as accommodating large numbers of candidates and ensuring reliable testing centers, influenced the decision.
  • The large rural student base underlines concerns about equity in the transition to online testing.
“To hold an entrance test in an online format, we can accommodate about 1.5 lakh candidates in one shift,” said a source in the government.

While the government aims to eventually migrate to online testing, no immediate changes are planned for the current exam format. Additional measures to prevent future paper leaks are yet to be disclosed.
newTitle: Govt Maintains Pen-and-Paper Format for NEET-UG 2025 Amid Paper Leak Controversy

title: Karnataka High Court reserves orders on BS Yediyurappa plea to quash POCSO case - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
Delhi HC Rejects Argument That Wife's Hospitalization Is Essential For Invoking S.498A, Says 'Narrow... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Delhi High Court Rejects Husband's Argument in Section 498A Case

Publication Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: Live Law

The Delhi High Court ruled against a husband's claim that his wife's hospitalization is necessary to prove cruelty under Section 498A of the Indian Penal Code.

  • The court emphasized that Section 498A is meant to protect women from various forms of cruelty, not limited to physical abuse with visible injuries.
  • Justice Swarana Kanta Sharma criticized the narrow interpretation, stating it could prevent justice for many women facing abuse.
  • The husband was denied anticipatory bail amid allegations of harassment and retaining the wife's belongings.
  • The court highlighted the husband's remarriage without consent as a sign of his disregard for the sanctity of marriage.
  • The judgment reinforces that emotional, mental, and financial cruelties also fall under the scope of Section 498A.
“Such a narrow interpretation would render Section 498A ineffective, silencing many victims and perpetuating cycles of abuse.” - Justice Swarana Kanta Sharma

This ruling is significant in affirming that the provisions of Section 498A are not limited to cases involving physical violence and extend to various forms of cruelty that women may suffer.
newTitle: Delhi High Court Rejects Husband's Argument in Section 498A Case

title: Bengaluru boy goes missing, found dead in pond near home - The News Minute
summary:
Bengaluru Boy Found Dead in Pond After Going Missing

Publication Date: January 16, 2023

Source: Local News Report

The body of a seven-year-old boy named Elvin D’souza was discovered in a pond near his home after he went missing, prompting an investigation into the circumstances of his death.

  • The boy was last seen on Thursday evening, January 16.
  • His parents reported him missing, leading to a search operation by local police.
  • Elvin's bicycle and slippers were found near the pond, indicating he may have drowned.
  • His body was recovered from the pond the following day.
  • The case has been classified as unnatural death, and investigations are ongoing.
The police are still verifying the exact circumstances of the incident.

This tragic event highlights safety concerns in local neighborhoods and the need for community awareness to protect children.
newTitle: Bengaluru Boy Found Dead in Pond After Going Missing

title: 12 Indians Fighting For Russian Army In Ukraine Killed, 16 Missing: Centre - NDTV
12 Indians working for Russian Army in Ukraine dead, 16 missing, confirms MEA - The Hindu
summary:
12 Indians working for Russian Army in Ukraine dead, 16 missing, confirms MEA

Published: January 17, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has confirmed that 12 Indians working with the Russian military have died, while 16 others are reported missing. Russia has communicated these details to India.

  • 12 Indians have been confirmed dead while working for the Russian military.
  • 16 Indians are reported missing, with efforts being made for their release and repatriation.
  • A total of 126 cases of Indian nationals serving in the Russian Army have been noted.
  • 96 Indians have returned to India and are no longer part of the Russian armed forces.
  • The Indian Embassy is involved in the repatriation of remains and treatment of the injured.
“The Russian side has categorised them as missing... We are seeking an early release and repatriation of those who remain.” - Randhir Jaiswal, MEA spokesperson

This situation highlights the ongoing risks faced by Indian nationals involved with foreign militaries amidst the conflict in Ukraine.
newTitle: 12 Indians working for Russian Army in Ukraine dead, 16 missing, confirms MEA
